SENT.plain: The association between the formation of intracranial aneurysms and situations of increased blood flow in certain areas of the brain is well accepted today
It has been seen in association with arteriovenous malformations of the brain, carotid occlusion, and Moyamoya disease
The occurrence of aneurysms in small arteries of the skull base, with the exception of the intracavernous carotid artery, however, is rare
We report a case of a 55-year-old woman who presented with an intracerebral hemorrhage caused by a ruptured anterior ethmoidal artery aneurysm
To the best of our knowledge, this is only the second case of documented intracranial bleeding from such a lesion
